name: Kettlebell Deadlifts
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing directly forward or slightly outward.

2. Hold the kettlebell with both hands, palms facing towards your body.

3. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.

4. Lower your body down until the kettlebell is close to the ground, keeping it near the center of your feet.

5. Focus on squeezing your glutes and pushing through your heels as you lift the weight back up to the starting position.

6. Keep your back straight and your shoulders relaxed throughout the movement.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Kettlebell deadlifts are a compound exercise that work multiple muscle groups, targeting the glutes, hamstrings, and lower back while requiring engagement from the core muscles.
